definition: to offer/to present/to dedicate/to donate/to show/to put on display/worthy person (old)
to offer respectfully/to consecrate/to dedicate/to devote
to offer advice/to make a suggestion
to commit one's energy to/to devote oneself to/to sacrifice one's life for/(coll.) (of a woman) to give one's virginity to
to offer flowers/to lay flowers (as a memorial)
to offer advice/to make a suggestion
to be particularly attentive to (an attractive young lady or man etc)/to fawn upon (an influential politician etc)/to court sb's favor/to ingratiate oneself
to ingratiate oneself with/to pander to
Xian county in Cangzhou 滄州|沧州[Cang1 zhou1], Hebei

sentences.english: Of whom Nadab and Abiu died, when they had offered the strange fire before the Lord.
sentences.chinese: 纳达布和阿彼胡在上主面前献了凡火，遭遇了死亡。

sentences.english: A wreath was laid on the monument to a fanfare of trumpets.
sentences.chinese: 在响亮的号角声中花圈被献在纪念碑前。

sentences.english: This shining, un-used day will bring.
sentences.chinese: 这灿烂，崭新的一天即将献呈。

sentences.english: So they went in to make sacrifices and burnt offerings.
sentences.chinese: 耶户和约拿达进去，献平安祭和燔祭。

sentences.english: While at Basel I had some conversation with Edith in regard to your attentions to her.
sentences.chinese: 在巴塞尔时我曾和伊迪丝谈了关于你对她献热情的事。

sentences.english: And if ye offer the blind for sacrifice, is it not evil?
sentences.chinese: 你们将瞎眼的献为祭物，这不为恶吗。

sentences.english: Give of your best to the Master;
sentences.chinese: 将你最好的献恩主，你心让主居首位。

sentences.english: Fan I ask story, also given ten first, make offer.
sentences.chinese: 蕃谨抚故事，亦赋十首献漕使。

sentences.english: When you sacrifice a fellowship offering to the Lord , sacrifice it in such a way that it will be accepted on your behalf.
sentences.chinese: 你们献平安祭给耶和华的时候，要献得可蒙悦纳。

sentences.english: And one he-goat for a sin - offering;
sentences.chinese: 又要献一只公山羊为赎罪祭。

sentences.english: From the first day of the seventh month began they to offer burnt offerings unto the LORD.
sentences.chinese: 从七月初一日起，他们就向耶和华献燔祭。

sentences.english: Some Young Pioneers presented some flowers to the visiting president.
sentences.chinese: 一些少先队员向来访总统献了鲜花。

sentences.english: Why do you scorn my sacrifice and offering that I prescribed for my dwelling?
sentences.chinese: 我所吩咐献在我居所的祭物，你们为何践踏。

sentences.english: Jade Dragon did descend, blue badger offered its skin.
sentences.chinese: 玉龙曾下降，瑞兽献蓝皮。

sentences.english: The oblation that ye shall offer unto the LORD shall be of five and twenty thousand in length, and of ten thousand in breadth.
sentences.chinese: 你们献与耶和华的供地要长二万五千肘，宽一万肘。

sentences.english: Prior to the meeting, President Hu laid flowers to the Monument of Independence and Humanism.
sentences.chinese: 会见前，胡锦涛向独立与人道主义纪念碑献花篮。

definition: to offer/to give (as tribute)/to devote (one's life)/to sacrifice (oneself)
to commit one's energy to/to devote oneself to/to sacrifice one's life for/(coll.) (of a woman) to give one's virginity to

to draw (e.g. a bow)/to pull/to stretch sth/to extend/to lengthen/to involve or implicate in/to attract/to lead/to guide/to leave/to provide evidence or justification for/old unit of distance equal to 10 丈[zhang4], one-thirtieth of a km or 33.33 meters
pouring of wine on ground for sacrifice
to offer (tribute)/to present respectfully (to superior, ancestor, deity etc)/to esteem/to revere/to believe in (a religion)/to wait upon/to accept orders (from superior)
to bestow/to confer (a reward for service)/a reward
to entertain/to repay/to return/to reward/to compensate/to reply/to answer
ode/eulogy/to praise in writing/to wish (in letters)
to lose/to leave behind/to omit/to bequeath/sth lost/involuntary discharge (of urine etc)
